text: I would rate this place a 4 star except that they have a bartender who clearly does not like her job.  The first time there, I attributed this to her having a bad day, but last night was the third time I've been there when she was working and she is very rude!  Very snotty! It wasn't just to me.  It was toward all the patrons there.  Never go on Wednesday night.  That's when she's working.  My friend and I like going there to play poker, catch up and grab a snack.  They do have great food there!  The patrons are so much fun too!  I feel comfortable there.  I just wish they'd get a different bartender who genuinely likes people and their job.

Good Food, HORRIBLE GAMBLING!!! This bar has really good food, but the gaming aspect of it is horrible!! The machines are as tight as can be with no payout, I play all poker games and keno and its a joke! Ive been in Vegas for 8 years and have never been to a worse bar for gambling. Oh and both Timbers down the street are just as bad! Stay clear away from this bar if you want to gamble, if you want some good food then check it out! On a side note about the food.. They serve it in a basket when it needs to be served on a plate. The basket gives no room for the food and makes everything a mess. A plate would be much more practical and classy. Thanks!

This place was close to where I lived before, so I used to go there for either lunch or dinner once a month. They've got pretty good food. My favorites are fish & chips and wraps. French fries are also very tasty. Always hot, crispy and well flavored.

Went in on the graveyard shift with my girl. Put $400 in the machines. I finally hit for a grand. I tipped Kyle $100. A little later he had what I consider a friend come in. They stood at the entrance to the bar and we're kissing. Inappropriate for a professional in my opinion. They, well he ignored the few people that were there for hours. When I politely asked for a drink. Example. "Excuse me Kyle, can we get another round?" I guess he didn't hear me. So I repeated myself.  Never did I say hey just excuse me. Out of the blue he turns to myself and my guest and says, loudly. "Don't fucking yell at me!" I was dumbfounded. I explained that I didn't yell at him I just thought he didn't hear me because he was busy with his tongue in her mouth. Yet he got as close to my face as he could and yelled "don't fucking yell at me!" If he can't leave his personal life at home and be professional we will never step foot in that place during graveyard again. My girl and I had never been treated like that from someone in the service industry before. We are both in the industry. I don't think a bartender or anyone should yell and especially cuss at customers. Goodbye edge of town.

Service : 5 stars *very nice Asian Bartender 

Atmosphere : 3 stars *Kinda Boring

Food : 4 stars *Chicken wings and fries

Overall: I like this place.
Macaroni and cheese with martini...a great way to end a long day. And the music in the bar area doesn't suck.

They need some culinary help at this place. It would seam they don't know how to cook or cut onions! They are raw and cut way to big for the dish I picked ( blackened chicken pastas) the sauce was even watery not cream like I'm sure is the menu spec! Very sad! 

This place could a great local attraction based on its location, but lack of attention to detail will be its demise
Had a late lunch here.  Server was nice to us.  Great reuben sandwich!  Coleslaw was good, too. (Not too mayo-y).  Husband had the meatloaf with mashed potatoes and liked it.  We'll be back.
Great comfort food. Excellent home made chile and French onion soup. Best fish and chips I ever had. Friendly staff. You are greeted and treated like old friends.

I have been to the Edge of Town a few times and found it to have good diner food reasonably priced. Today I tried their Bow Tie Chicken Noodle soup. The soup had only five very small chunks of chicken in very thin broth. I told the waitress that  I was very disappointed because of such a small quantity of chicken in it. She blew me off with oh the scooper didn't do too well. I got charged $4 and did not even get an apology. Is this a business that wants returning customers?
Service is great as is the food! The only drawback is no beer on tap. We frequent this place because it is close to home and comfortable.

Don't eat here! I came with my family and had an awful experience.  I TRIED to order chicken fingers and fries at 11:15 am only to be refused service saying they don't serve lunch until noon.  I ordered French toast (which was mediocre).  When our food was finally served AN HOUR LATER (at 12:15 pm and after numerous inquiries with our server as to what was taking so long), I saw the table right next to us being served lunch.  Talk about rubbing salt in the wound.  I didn't enjoy my food and the people right next to us got the good I ACTUALLY wanted.  Upon finding out we were unhappy with the order, the manager gave us dirty looks as if WE were the problem.  Don't eat here!

My buddies and I all went here for lunch last weekend. All 4 of us had fantastic dishes. We talked about how rare that was that everything was delicious for the entire group.  I personally had the chop salad with was 5 stars.
Gotta love a warm Bloody Mary, freezer burned packaged hashbrowns and packaged chicken fried steak for breakfast.

I order hot wings to go. I asked how many wings their were per order, they said 10. I got my to-go order and there was only 8 wings in my box. I called and ask how many wings are per order, they said 10 per pound. They should be more accurate with their food orders, I was not expecting this mishap when ordering.

Terrible clientele   So many people bitching rude take over machines loud. Terrible music!!Nice bartenders. How do they tolerate the area mean.  Geez. Get some good music and why do you attract overbearing people?  Duct tape is needed. Actually you all enjoy your peeps.  Just not my type. Dang!

Meals at the Edge are just amazing. Their loaded Mac and Cheese is awesome!! 

The environment is nice. The restaurant seating is away from the bar area so it's completely smoke free :)

I eat here fairly regularly since it's close to home.  I love the New York Steak, their grilled cheese sandwich, the pork sliders, and the two-egg breakfast.  Not a huge fan of the fries or salmon.  And I wish they had more desserts.  I haven't had a great dessert here.  But they have great service, enthusiastic servers, and it's very family friendly.
We love this place! Always great service ( Thanks Jason and his staff)! Pizza and wings are our favorite!

We visited my wife's aunt in Vegas. She insisted we go to this bar and grill for dinner. What a disappointment. 2 of us ordered the fish and chips after being assured by the server that this was "Excellent". Apparently his definition of excellent is the same as my definition of horrible. It was frozen cod in batter about 3/8 inch batter top and bottom and so hard you could use it as a sanding block. 

You would think that I could have let the server know, but we didn't see him until he delivered the check about 25 minutes later. I have 1 suggestion for him. It looks like you hate your job, go find one where you don't have to work with the public. Maybe he just didn't like working.

My wife had the patty melt. At least that was edible, but nothing to rave about. I can easily say that I will never return to this establishment.

Not sure why the hate for this place. Dropped in this past Saturday to watch the Final Four games in the bar area. The place is clean and the service was great. Bartender took care of us while we played video poker and watched the games. We will definitely go back.
Good food, fair price and a friendly atmosphere. typically come here for lunch, so I thought I would try dinner.

My wife and I decided to give this place a try for lunch on a Tuesday. The waitress told us ahead of time that the fries were the best thing on the menu. She was absolutely right!! Maybe the best fries ever, well seasoned and crispy texture!! The burger was a half pound and juicy, cooked to perfection!! The onion rings were fabulous, and the fried egg on the burger was perfect!! Nicole was our waitress, she was great!! 

We went to Bobby Flay's restaurant on the Strip on Sunday, and were very disappointed by the food. Read my review. Way better food here!!
Giving this 2 star review solely for the fact that they served a Moscow Mule in a pint glass. It was a sad day for all mule lovers.

We had a great time last night, the service was good and the atmosphere was what we expected. We used to come here regularly but we moved to a different part of town. It was good to see most of the same faces

I haven't tried the food because to be quite honest, I ended up here looking for a happy hour. This place was horrible, it took 10 minutes for anyone to even acknowledge that we were there. They only serve bottled beer, nothing on draft.......not my kind of establishment. I can serve myself bottles at home. Needless to say, we left without ordering anything and have never been back. Very disappointing.

I placed a simple breakfast order at 7 in the morning I was the only one in the bar and they shorted me an entire breakfast I got all the way back to my job and I had to come back up there to get my breakfast and they acted like it was  no big deal that they messed up the order and I gave her a tip I will never eat there again the food was not that good Timbers is better.
We stopped by one evening and the food and service was really great! I definitely will return.

I strictly used this bar as an initial Tinder-first-date-meetup venue when I lived on the Northwest side of town.

Overall, it's a pretty solid place.  Even if you're not being a sleaze bag like me and doing Tinder hookups, it'd definitely be a quality place to meet up with friends and catch up.  You don't have to worry about loud music or anything like that.

I always had excellent experiences with their staff.  Everyone who works there has an upbeat attitude and makes you feel welcomed.

I give it four stars because of the food, but still not bad for bar food.

Great experience from start to finish. We're a family of four with kids 8 and 4. Our server was fantastic! She had great menu knowledge and fantastic with the kids. Burgers and ribs came out quick and cooked perfectly (burger med-rare with lots of pink in the center). The dining room was kept clean and plates were cleared as we finished.

The Edge of Town upon making entry is divided up into bar section and the restaurant section.  I have visited both an equal number of times.  A-OK is based on the average.  

The bar side is dimly lit and depending who is tending bar, my previous experiences have fluctuated between a three & four star experience.  

The restaurant on the the other hand has been a solid four star every time.  Lunch was a pleasant experience with a solid burger to boot.  Breakfast was also pleasant with a solid breakfast sandwich and a cup of joe that never ran empty.

As for a watering hole...the verdict is still out there.  But for eats....I would not hesitate.
Burgers and fries are delicious! Nicole was our food server and her personality and service was absolutely superb. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

Visited this restaurant for the first time a few days ago. I like how the dining area is separate from the gaming and the smoke. It looked like it was busy just before we arrived there to seat ourselves because there were a few empty tables but none were clean. The waitresses were very nice but seemed very overwhelmed considering the fact that there were only like 2 or three of them. We ordered the potato skins that were pretty good but you can really mess up a potato skin too bad and the ranch was delicious. For our meals we ordered the pot roast plate and the bbq pizza. The was not great at all, not even good. I ordered the pot roast because I knew I would have left overs for the following day but I didn't want to eat it for dinner let alone the next day. Both the meals tasted like banquet frozen dinners. I told my boyfriend that we should have just went to the Walmart in the same shopping plaza and picked up a California pizza kitchen pizza and a Marie calendars frozen meal from the freezer section for less than half the price. Instead of sending the food back like I wanted to my boyfriend insisted i not say anything and we just won't be going back. Should have stuck with our original plan and go to The Draft House instead of trying some where new.

This review is for the restaurant portion, not the bar. My wife and I have been here a few times before. We have always had one of the different types of burgers there. This time we had the Bacon Cheeseburger, which we have had before, and beer battered fries. There is a reason why we order this, because the burger is very juice and a good size. Normally I can finish a burger in one sitting, but I have yet to finish one at Edge of Town (great for lunch for the next day!) 

We had Brooke as our server, very friendly and personable to us. We learned that she lives close to us, so we might even have a play date with our children in the near future. 

But back to the food, very generous helps, wait staff is very attentive and courteous. We ate in the restaurant portion and not the bar. Both are in separate areas and separated by doors and rooms, so thankfully none of the cigarette smell from the bar area care over. I would recommend this place to anyway looking for something casual and tasty!
Decent enough place, although pretty much par for the course compared to the many bar food spots around town.
Great hole in the wall atmosphere but service was very slow and bar wasn't even busy.  Food was OK had the jalapeño burger not bad but not the bomb.

So wanted this to be our new "joint."  We stumbled across this place one afternoon so decided to come back for dinner with friends.  Restaurant side is just that - family friendly restaurant.  But the restaurant was dead when we went.  Says the place is smoke-free - that is the restaurant side only.  Bar is smoking and they need a better filtration system.  We sat on the bar side.  On a Friday night - prime time - 7-11pm we were there.  Place was dead.  Lucky if there were 10 people at the bar the whole time we were there.  Food ordered:  Blue Cheese sliders.  No taste to them.  Blue cheese and bacon bits all were on the plate instead of the burgers.  No condiment on the burgers at all.  No taste.  Blah.  French fries were good - battered.  Someone also got a personal pizza.  Just okay.  Drinks - Coors Light for a friend.  An IPA for my hubs.  Can't mess up a beer.  However, I got the raspberry lemon drop martini - first one great, second one eh, third one CRAP.   My friend got cranberry and vodka.  First one great, second one eh, third one just cranberry at that point.  Drinks went down hill.  Service was fantastic - whoever the young kid was, he as on his game.  But would never go back.  Drink quality stinks,  Food quality not worth returning, atmosphere was dead, place was boring.  Our search continues.
Food is pretty good. Nothing I've ever had was so great that I craved it again. Prices are ok. Atmosphere is usually pretty quite.

This place really is at the edge of town. This bar/grill is located on Cheyenne/215 in the Walmart shopping center. Walking in, you go left to the bar or straight to the dining area. The dining room was not full so were able to seat ourselves. High chairs were available.

The French onion soup which I ordered to start, looked sooo much better than it tasted. I enjoyed the melty cheese and bread on top, (who doesn't love that part?) and there was a good amount of onions, but the broth was not very flavorful. For my main course I ordered the fish and chips. It came with one large piece of breaded fish (cod) , fries, coleslaw and tarter sauce. I enjoyed the slaw. It was cold, creamy and tangy. The fish was okay the breading wasn't very flavorful. I did not like the tarter sauce. The fries are breaded which I don't mind. They tasted better dipped in the house made ranch though. 

The rest of the food seemed to be a hit or miss. Mom's mashed potatoes came out cold, but her chopped steak was good. Dad ordered the steak burrito which was huge, but he didn't really care for it. It came with a side of beans that looked like canned dog food. Bf got the ribs unsauced and at least they were fall off the bone tender. 

The service was the best part. Out server was kind and patient with us, and made sure to take care of any issues that we had throughout our meal. For 4 of us plus tax and tip it was almost $80! A bit pricey for bar food if you ask me. I can't say I'd hurry back here anytime soon.

I'd hoped this would be my neighborhood bar. But the food is just ok and the beer selection leaves a bit to be desired. Draft beer is where it's at, guys. 

But the service is great. When I mentioned being new to the area and that my bottle opener was still in a moving van making it's way across the country the bartender sent me home with one of his bottle openers. Just so I wouldn't have to drink bud light. 

Fresh beef for your burgers (instead of frozen) and draft beer would make this a 4 1/2 star place
I like the edge of town! I got a Pepsi and some southwestern egg rolls and that's the edge of town.
Friendly service, quality food, affordable prices. There's a lot to choose from and you can't go wrong. This IS a kid friendly place, if you're wondering.
Smokehouse burger is great. I asked medium I got medium well but still very good

Four couples had dinner and conversation on a Saturday night before going to a show. Two of the couples were regulars and two were virgins at this local's kinda place. Suggested items were salads or burgers. Food just okay. My bleu cheese hamburger was kinda bland. Kitchen didn't have 1/2 and 1/2 for my coffee. Prices were reasonable. Smoke-free dining is separate from bar where smoking is allowed. Staff was good. But probably won't come back.

I was in the mood for chicken noodle soup, so I decided to give this place another chance. My service was great like last time, and the food was much better. The grilled cheese on sourdough and chicken soup really hit the spot. I would have given it a full 5 stars this time, but my soup was mostly broth, not a lot of meat, veggies or noodles. A gentleman next to me ordered a burger and it looked delicious - I think we will be checking it out again to try one of those!
Cheap food, generous portions. The menu is full of guilty pleasures. My only qualm - the fries my daughter ordered were not edible to her as they tasted like fish. We went on a Friday...

Enjoyed breakfast there for my first visit.  Definitely looking forward to next time.  Breezed through the menu....saw meatloaf, spaghetti and meatballs....for me, that falls under the category of "be back much sooner than later".  Service exceeded my expectations.  When i walked in, well....it was very impressive how clean it is.  for me, the edge of town will be my talk of the town.....

The food here is always good and the servers are all very nice. It's not a busy restaurant so you seat yourself and it is never a long wait for your food. It's close to home and it's good for families. They make the best roast beef sandwich with an jus. Mmmmm. We come here often and have never had a bad experience.
Great local hang out. Amazing customer service and good food. Love the prime rib and the pizza.

My dad is #obsessed with their fish and chips!! We come here at LEAST once a week. My fave is their breakfast sandwich. Comfortable atmosphere and friendly service along with huge portions and good prices make this place one of our faves!

I went to the edge of town, excited to try the new bars on the NW side of las vegas and nobody would acknowledge me or my fiancé.  We were unable to place an order for drinks or food.  We ended up leaving and going to Timbers up the street. 

Timbers is always so welcoming. They're professional and the food is good. I wouldn't waste my time returning to the edge of town. You guys suck.

My sister, her BF, and I came here for lunch. We went to the diner area, and there was one male server and another table with only two people who were practically finished eating.

I got the hamburger and it was from a frozen patty and possibly the WORST hamburger I ever had. The coleslaw was also TERRIBLE. My sister got three pieces of chicken fingers with her fries (the paprika on the fries makes them worthwhile). Her BF got the chili cheese fries which he found to be promising as well. I believe the fries are the only thing worth any time here.

The server was HORRID. He ended up not filling up my water, not asking how the food was, and crippling around like a sloth. He watched TV, I had to wave him down about six times, and even got up once to get him. Lazy? Probably. Doesn't care? Most likely? Handicapped? Doubt it.

I really like this place. The bar is really big... There's a lot of tables in the dining area... And the menu is pretty extensive. 

I'm vegan and I always order sautéed veggies... And they always accommodate me, even though it isn't on the menu. Their food is really good;) 

They have a full bar... I always go late at night when Kyle is there. He's a really great bartender and he always makes me feel welcomed;) they have wine... Which is a huge plus because that's my drink of choice. They also offer plenty of options for games on the machines. I would definitely recommend this place if you are in the area with friends... Or grabbing a drink for some alone time!

So after the bar across the street (timbers) forgot cheese on my nachos (how you forget cheese on enchilada nachos I don't know) anyways, I decided to give edge of town a try. I called and specifically asked if the nachos had meat and said no meat if they did. I was ensured they did NOT meat. However when I arrived home I found the nachos did include meat, I'm vegetarian. I work in the service industry and have no problem with mistakes, but if you don't know the answer to something don't act like you do. Find out! Upon calling the bar back and asking for a refund I was told by the bartender he didn't know if I could get a refund or just money credited towards something else. How do you not know your return policy ?!?! The bartender finally told me he would leave money from "his own pocket" for the return, but would that include the $5 tip I left for the $11 nachos I guess we'll see when I go back later this afternoon. Customer service was a huge NO at this place.

I was hoping for a better experience.  Beer list is slight above average for "neighborhood" bars in Las Vegas.  Food is average:  I've had chicken wings, french toast, and chicken fried steak.  Bartenders were great, wait staff wasn't too friendly.  I might be back for a beer.  Maybe.

We live down the street so this has become our escape to shirk cooking and cleaning for the night.  We stopped in "just because" and have since been back multiple times. 

It's quiet and comfortable in the restaurant, which is completely separate from the bar. There's usually only one waitress on duty, but none have ever let us finish a drink before it's refilled.  The food is straight comfort food and we've never had a dish we didn't like.  Nothing fancy, but good, cheap and quick.

Good food great service. Bar food taken to the next level. Sit in the bar for beer specials and food specials. Happy Hour and beer of the month. Try the meatball sliders. They are very tasty. I mean seriously who doesn't like a tasty ball in your mouth.....meatballs people meatballs.
1st time visiting....Excellent food.... service matches... highly recommend .. great prices match the great food..
Love this place after a long week. The bar is spotless. Staff always knows our names and drinks. Wish they had a few more menu items but will trade clean seats for that any day

If you have special dietary needs, you'd better go elsewhere.  We went here for breakfast the day after Thanksgiving and when we arrived about 10 am, there was no one here but our group.  We asked if there was cheese in the breakfast burritos, as it was NOT included in the ingredients on the menu.  We were told, "only on the top," so we requested for the two lactose intolerant patrons, that it be left off.  It was, but the inside was teeming with cheese.  The new french toast orders were not comped, which hey, they risked making my daughters getting sick for a day while on vacation. What if they were deathly allergic to peanuts?  Not to be trusted!
Great appetizers and entrees! Fair prices too
The food is decent. You can't go wrong with the blackened chicken pasta or their roast beef on Texas toast. If I'm not playing pool at timbers then I'm here gambling and having a good time.

My favorite bar in ALL of Vegas.  Great atmosphere, and damn good food.  I mean EVERYTHING on the menu is delicious!  The staff is so fun, accommodating and the experience is always top notch.  Make sure you save room for dessert, a hot molten cookie with ice cream & fudge.... gooey yummy deliciousness!  Enough TV's for anyone to watch whatever you'd like.  Music is always rockin' and video poker, blackjack & Keno.  What more could you want?  They have it covered.

I am glad I didn't look at the reviews before I came to this place. I think the reviews would have jaded me and this place is GREAT. I mean it. When we were deciding where to go to dinner we decided we wanted some bar food and wanted to try one of the numerous Nevada style taverns. 

Edge of Town it is. Our server was Brittany, she was awesome, very attentive and helpful. Everything on the menu sounds really good. 

I started off with their homemade bowtie chicken noodle soup and he got their chili. Both were really good in fact we're going to go there just for the soup and chili one night. Warning the chili has a little kick to it!  The chicken soup was nice and hearty and had real chunks of chicken in it. 

I could not resist trying the onion soufflé. It was so good! Served hot with toasted crostini and melted cheeses. Yes, it's a delicious heart attack in a crock dish. My companion had the pot roast melt. Let's talk about the bread it came on. It came on a bun that had toasted cheese and onions on top of it!! We asked if next time we could get a burger on that bun and they are pretty much willing to do any kind of substitution or make anything you want as long as they have the components. I tried pot roast melt I don't even like pot roast and I liked this one!

Since the food was so good up until that point, I decided to try to bread pudding since it was back by popular demand. My thinking was this has got to be some great bread pudding if it's back. Apparently people were asking for it. It was edible. It was not terrible. But it wasn't the best bread pudding I've ever had. It really wasn't worth all the calories I only ate half of it. Our server did suggest though that we should try the cookie sundae next time, because its better than the bread pudding. I like honest servers and that was very helpful! 

We are definitely going back and they include coupons our server told us in the coupon value packs you get in the mail.

This was a classic experience where Less Is More could have been employed to make it better.  After passing by this joint many times, my Mom and I stopped by for lunch on Sunday.

I ordered the Triple Cheese Burger (Swiss, Cheddar, Provolone) with a side of Thai Slaw.  Mom ordered the Blackened Chicken Sandwich (Cajun Chicken blackened in an iron skillet, topped with onions, peppers and melted jack cheese with a cajun mayo on a ciabatta roll) with a side of Thai Slaw.

Here's the breakdown....the Burger has a lot of potential.  I like to put Cole Slaw on my Burger, so I put some of the Thai Slaw on it.  It was juicy, but there was simply too much Cheese on it.  I couldn't taste the Burger and the Cheese flavors were indistinguishable.  The Thai Slaw has some serious potential too, but it was way too runny.  After the first few bites of the Slaw, the bowl was full of liquid so the rest of the Slaw was 'soupy'.....too much sauce and very, very sweet.  Also, there was a ton of Peanuts in the Slaw.  I don't know if they meant to do that, but it overwhelmed the flavor....also, I expect a Thai Slaw to have some heat in it...their version doesn't.

I had 1/2 of Mom's Blackened Chicken Sandwich....again, they should employ the Less Is More Rule here.  The Sandwich was topped with a bunch of Grilled Onions, then fresh Onions....it was Onion overload!  The Chicken had a good, char-smoked flavor, but was lacking a Spicy Kick that I would expect from a Cajun flavored Chicken.

Overall, it was a good experience....not great, but good.

Will I return?  I probably will to try other items on the menu.

OMG I've never written a review for the Edge of Town??
This is the closest all around American restaurant to home for me. I've been alot of times. 
They have a bar and restaurant that are truly separated the way they're supposed to be. So if you're having dinner, you don't get bombarded with smoke. You can take your kids and be comfortable. They have high chairs. 
The food is really decent. Try their giant pretzel appetizer. It's so huge it'll make you laugh. And super tasty with the beer cheese. 
My favorites are the pretzel, the taco salad, the pot roast sandwich and the spicy chicken sandwich.  Never had anything bad. 
Good service.  Same servers have been there forever.
Only bad thing is no draft beer. Whaaaaat???  If they'd fix that, I'd be there way more often. 
If you are in the area and looking for decent variety of normal American bar/comfort food, drop in. They have dinners too. I'm just usually not wanting that much food.

I stopped by this place for lunch.  Even though I don't drink I was looking for some food. I ordered a cheese burger. It came out in about 10 minutes and was huge! I also liked the seasoning on the fries they where unique. The employees were friendly. The place was clean and cozy. I'd recommend trying this place of you are in the area. I think it would also be a good place for a get together with friends.

Glad I gave this place a second chance. 
I've tried their wings and honey chicken salad. LOVED them BOTH! I'm actually back for them. 
Their hot wings have a franks red hot/ Asian chili paste/ sriracha kinda flavor. Not sure what's really in their hot wings but they're damn good and they have good RANCH! Fries are great too.
The honey chicken salad is great too. 
Bartender is always a pleasure. He really interacts with his regulars takes great care of everyone at the bar.
Just wish there was no smoking in the bar. But I guess that's what the dinning side is for ;)

Been here at least 50 times, but Never again. My family loves the BBQ sliders so we ordered three plates no pickles, no slaw on any of them and 2 water and a soda drink. Waited for 12 minutes waitress comes with them places in front of us we pull off the buns slaw dripping down them and pickle on the plate. We told the waitress we ordered without slaw and without pickles (I'm allergic to cabbage). She took them all back as the others don't like slaw and son allergic to milk. 8 minutes later she comes back with the baskets, I asked for ranch and ketchup she went to get. I pull the top of my buns and see a lighter sauce and cabbage we were furious the scrapped off what slaw they could mixed the meats and gave them back to us cold fries and all! We told the waitress someone could really get sick them doing this had I not pulled up the bun and seen what they did. We told her we can't eat them and would go elsewhere and I wanted the bill. She came back and said the manager said the soda was on him. Didn't apologize for what they did which was sneaky. I will never go back here, they don't care about customers. It's wrong to deceive paying customers.

Great place to eat! Awesome food and the staff is just incredibly friendly!! Definitely a place I was continue to visit. Always support the small business owners... Very family friendly as well and smoke-free!! You're missing out if you haven't tried this place yet!

First time here and felt welcomed at the bar from the time we sat down. Played the machines, had some drinks and ate some good food, well good bar food! Point is first time here and we felt welcomed from the time we came in. Too many bars cater to the regulars. Mad props to Jason and Pomai they were great and treated us like we we're regulars!!! We just moved to this side of town yesterday and found a drinking home already.
Amazing food!! Staff is very friendly and  attentive, food is home comfort food if you go you have to try the pot roast platter !! It taste like your grandma was cooking in the kitchen all day long.

So I don't visit the bar side because I have a little one who is my side. In fact I haven't been there past 2 in the afternoon, so this may or may not help you. 

We go for breakfast and lunch regularly and really enjoy the food. We have tried many items and all are yummy! They have coupons in ValPak all the time, so it is pretty inexpensive as well. The service is always great and everyone is friendly when we are there.

Not sure what happened...Went for a nice early Sunday breakfast and no one was there to seat us - no one eating, only 4 smoking barflies in the casino section, dark, smelly, so disappointed -- we left hungry after we finally flagged down a kitchen person who was leaving the restroom and told us that the wait staff would not be in until 7:45 am or so...? Reviews seemed so good, and we thought it was a 24 hour place --? Maybe we will try again, when the staff is present and accounted for...

Still looking for one of the great diners we heard are stock and trade in LV. -- Just moved here and apparently we are looking for food in all the wrong places...

We we looking for some place casual to bring a 12 girl softball team to eat lunch between games.  We had a total party of 22. The service was great and even with 22 the meals were delivered quickly. Our group had nachos, burgers, salads and wraps. Everyone commented on how good the food was. Great food at reasonable prices.

I love this place! It's super close to my house so it's the most convenient place for a quick dinner/drink. We go all the time, like at least once a week, and the menu has so many options we never get bored of it. Plus at the beginning of every month you get a 20% off coupon in ValPack! 

Because we are regulars, my husband and I actually had our rehearsal dinner for our wedding here! It was a little different, but we worked with the owner to set it up and the staff was great because we know them all...it was a great personal touch to our event!

Have been here for dinner twice, and both times have been impressed by the quality and quantity of the food, as well as the friendly and prompt service. The dining area is separate from the bar/gaming so families are welcome, something a few other neighborhood establishments (I'm looking at you, Timbers) should consider.

There's lots of options on the menu, apps, salads, burgers, dinners, and even breakfast. Something for just about everyone, much like the other grill/tavern places around. The prices seem quite reasonable, particularly for the aforementioned quality and quantity.

The only downside is there's no draft beer. Maybe it's just me, but I like sticking my nose into a fresh, frosty pint instead of getting another sterile bottle. Step up your game here and it's 5 stars for sure.

In the center of the sprawl, it's hard to find places with much of an identity, but this one seems to be pretty unique. I really liked the service and the food was probably in the 4 star range (we got breakfast). My only complaint is that it's a casino and it's not that unique to deserve returning to over and over again.

It's been a while since my last visit to Edge of Town, so it's time for an update, mostly to counteract some of the not-so-great reviews that have been posted.  I'm happy to say that our experience was fairly positive.

It was a bit later on a Tuesday night, so once again we knew we'd be closing a restaurant.  We ordered two glasses of wine to start, some white zin Koolaid (yeah, I know.  It's not wine, you snobs).  It was not a great white zin, way too flimsy.

Having been shunning red meat since the horsemeat scare in Europe, from whence we'd just returned, I decided to go whole hog :) and ordered a Baja Burger.  The meat was fresh, juicy, and cooked medium, exactly the way I ordered it, and the chopped green chilis and jalapeno jack added the right kick.  It wasn't a problem to substitute mashed for the fries/chips/coleslaw option, and I was happy to taste REAL mashed potatoes with their skins that were perfectly seasoned and not oversalted.  That's a tough combination, but the kitchen nailed it.

Hubby had the Cajun chicken over bowtie pasta, but instead of the cream sauce of the description he was able to get it with the house red sauce, which was thick and delicious.  The chicken was a good-sized breast and, again, well-seasoned without being overly salty.  It came with garlic bread, but instead of Italian bread it was a flat bread, and it just didn't work - way too soft.

Service was excellent, and my only quibble was waiting a bit too long for our food to come.  Odd, since we were now the only diners.  But glad that the food was worth waiting for.
Eh this place is ok for takeout once in a while. Breakfast is ok eggs are the only thing they can cook consistently. Staff is usually nice but way to chatty and a bit slow
Food is really good slots suck though always come here to gamble never win more then 90 bucks

First off , I don't like a bartender who thinks i'm stupid and tries pushing his slot machines off on us as soon as we walk in and sit down. Then tries telling us gambling on sports can get you in trouble . For one sports betting is the only game to consistently win at . And his slots are for drunks and to fill the bars pockets . Do not fall for his nice guy game . Do not play their slots you will not win . You don't have to throw your money away to get the workers to be nice to you . Because thats all they want . And 4.75 for a bottle of beer ? Please I can get free beer at any casino for betting sports anytime . If it was a classy place I would not have a problem . When we left he never said good bye . I seen right thru him from the start .He showed his true colors . I'm glad I didn't play his little slot machines and if your smart you won't either . Don't waste your time here the Red Rock Casino is real close by .

This bar is THE BEST local bar in Vegas. It's slightly reminiscent of the bar from Cheers, no joke.

From the very first time I went to this bar, I had a nickname given to me by the bar staff. They remember me every time I go in there whether it be after a couple of months or a couple of weeks. There isn't a single bartender that I don't like at this bar and even the owner is constantly present. I really enjoy coming here and I would suggest this bar to anyone who wants good food, friendly atmosphere, and an overall pleasant environment.

Okay, first off I do not personally know or work for anyone associated with this bar. I do live within 5 minutes away. I have read as of 6/6/'12 all of the reviews.

I have to say due to their way out west location, I understand why the restaurant section is only staffed in peak hours. It isn't a nation wide chain, that can afford to employ bored employees that stand around waiting for people who aren't coming. As far as any specials(Happy Hour/Monday night football/Ladies Night) go, this is a local's joint, people go there because it is close to home & not a PT's or a Timber's or a Station Casino. I really believe that specials would not bring in any more business for them. Of the local's bars, based on food & service, in general, I believe, Steiner's & Putter's are the best, Timber's is my standard, PT's is, in general the worst, but has the best specials. I put The Edge Of Town, ahead of Timber's. Being a 24 hour joint, like all 24 hour joints, the food quality & service is going to vary. I will say at The Edge Of Town, I have always had fast friendly service & someone has always greeted me, even if it is just a: Hey, how you guys doing? Did you need menus, I'll come right over, after I get this drink order, from the lone bartender working Graveyard. This is exactly what I want from my local bar.

My take... I love their burgers & most of the other items on the menu. The service has always been better than every self-seating restaurant. Kid friendly? I have no idea? As a smoker, I have only sat in the bar section. I often wonder why people take their children to any local's joint or places that serves hard alcohol? Lack of specials? Hell, I am a local, I am not looking for the cheapest deal in town & I tip for service. If I didn't live in the area, would I drive across town to eat & drink here, honestly, no, but I wouldn't drive across town just to eat & drink at any other local's bar either. I would drive for Sushi Bomb(next door) & have a couple real drinks after dinner at The Edge Of Town. I am glad that The Edge Of Town is my neighborhood bar. In the same relative area, there are 2 Timbers & a Steiner's. I rarely get good service at any Timber's & the restaurant staff is constantly changing at Steiner's, so their service varies. 

The Edge Of Town is a local's bar & they treat you like a local. If you live way the F west on Cheyenne, give it a shot & tell me that I am wrong.

I really like this place. Good bar food, good video poker. They have some interesting video keno options I've not seen elsewhere. Try the macaroni and cheese it's pretty tasty. It really is on the edge of town!

Really friendly people and great food. I had the cajun chicken pasta and the loaded mac and cheese: mac and cheese was amazing and the pasta was just okay. Take out was hot and ready for me to pickup at the bar on time no waiting really nice.

Four stars for the great service.  We just stopped in to order take out and play 20 while we waited. Came out superstar and we really appreciated how kindly we were treated. The food ended up being delicious,  they take pride in their presentation even in take out!
Always awesome!   Great staff!   Great drinks!    Friendly atmosphere. Great for a Friday night low key get together.

I will tell you this..... Do NOT eat here. The food is terrible, 26 bucks down the drain for an order of chicken tenders, soda and a dip sandwich. I'll let you decide after seeing the pictures. 

With that being said, I have this 3 stars and almost want to do 4 because of the service and the bar vibe. Our waitress was great, which sucks she probably gets screwed on tips because the food is just that bad. Mind you I don't have high standards for bar food but it should be better than mc Donald's. 

Anyway, so the waitress was great. So we decided to throw 40 bucks in the slots. Eh. They wernt the best BUT the bartender was amazing! I mean she made us feel so welcomed and she made the whole experience so much better. I'm an idiot for not getting her name but we will be back for gaming because of the staff.

Came back to this place and it was as delicious as the first time! I got the chopped salad again and they were more than willing to switch out the cheese and dressing to my taste. Salad came out looking beautiful and fresh and my boyfriend got the meatloaf. He said everything was cooked perfectly and tasted delicious. Potato skins were as delicious as before. Our waitress Nina (nEYEnah, as she pronounced it) was very sweet and kind. She made jokes with us and talked to us as though we were personal friends with her. I would come back just for her. If you come here, ask for her! Such a lovely woman.

This a good place. It's since local bar with good food and super nice staff.  We have had dinner, lunch and breakfast and have enjoyed it each time. The staff is so nice and efficient. It's a great local bar and grill.

This is a nice bar and grille much better than your regular chain restaurants.  The restaurant is seperate from the bar so it is quiet and relaxing.  The food is excellent.

If you are on the west side of town check it out.  nice place.

I go to the edge of town often for a few simple reasons. There a kid friendly first and foremost for me. There service is always friendly and active which I like. And there food has always been consistently good. However the last two times I've been there I ordered there burger with carmalized onions and the onions came out raw on my burger under melted cheese. I told my server about it and she talked with the cook and he gave her a ton of attitude about how they are carmalized to him. And these onions were diced and warmed at best far from grilled let alone carmalized. I won't give up on them yet but I hope this isn't a bad sign that things are going downhill. 

I would still give them majority stars because there food is consistently good minus there inability to carmalize an onion and there dining room staff is always on point. I wish them the best and hope they can remain a nice local spot.

This diamond is fabulous..best ribs in town....

Staff wonderful, friendly, and so nice.  All the food has a home town feel..burgers..delish...order the gigantic pretzel..yum

We are here weekly...would be here more often , but we like a meal at home once in a while lol lol

I go in to get my girlfriend a large bowl of chicken noodle soup and i receive the smallest cup ive ever seen in my life. Of course it wasn't opened up and presented to me while I was there... It was plastic bagged and knotted... After I get home... 45 seconds later since i live right behind the place i open it up and its not even hot. I can stick my finger inside and leave it there without even the slightest burn... I call them to ask why this wouldn't even be an appetizer for my 6 year old daughter let alone my adult GF... And he says that's the biggest size they have... This is insane! It's smaller than 1 cup. I could literally pour this tiny thing into a 1 serving size measuring cup... Kyle the bartender says basically, "next time you come in i'll buy you a couple beers." Fuck that.. My girlfriend is sick, and wants a decent size BOWL OF SOUP! Never come to this place! And to top of off, i also asked for some garlic bread... Which they didn't have, but they gave me some breadsticks... And charged me a buck for each one...  Wtf is this shit? I also asked for NO ONIONS on a side salad... Which by the way actually looks good... But there is onions all over it... Big nasty red onions that I'm allergic too... Thanks Kyle! Appreciate wasting 30 minutes sitting inside waiting for this mess of a dinner that your cook tried to give to me to eat at the place when you put on the ticket that its a TO GO order!
The food was very good. The mac and cheese was wonderful. The drinks were very good. The service (ricky) was superb.
